title.narrative: ALLIANCES WITH PRIVATE SECTOR AND MEDIA

description.narrative: By the end of 2015, engagement with media and the private sector result in the application of child-rights oriented standards and an increase in financial and non-financial contributions to social inclusion, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Field Office Oversight, Management And Operations Support, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Private Sector Fundraising, Psfr Modalities Non-Post. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2015, Serbia's child rights infrastructure will be strengthened and civic and private engagement enhanced to realize children's rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2015, engagement with media and the private sector result in the application of child-rights oriented standards andan increase in financial and non-financial contributions to social inclusion
Number of strategic corporate partners engaged and extent of their financial and non-financial support to programmes for children

baseline.value: In 2010 4 partners contributed a total of 54,000 US$

target.value: 2015:20% increase in the number of strategic corporate partners and 20% increase in their financial and non-financial contribution

actual.value: 2015:6 corporate partners contributed with US$ 456,000 in 2015 (income from global Telenor – US$ 109,000 included)

title.narrative: Availability and implementation of child rights standards in practices of media organizations (programme, reporting)

target.value: 2015:Standards for TV content rating developed, adopted and implementation monitored by the Republic Broadcasting Regulatory Agency (RRA)

actual.value: 2015:Regulation on Protection of Rights of Minors in the Field of Provision of Media Services adopted by the Regulatory Authority of Electronic Media (REM)Support to implementation of the Regulation in progressThree media partnerships on child rights established
